TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed MembershipSection extends System.Configuration.ConfigurationSection

Docs.summary: Defines configuration settings to support the infrastructure for configuring and managing membership details. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The MembershipSection class provides a way to programmatically access and modify the `membership` section in a configuration file.
## Examples This example demonstrates how to specify values declaratively for several attributes of the `membership` section, which can also be accessed as members of the MembershipSection class.
The following configuration file example shows how to specify values declaratively for the `membership` section.
``` <system.web> <membership defaultProvider="AspNetSqlMembershipProvider" userIsOnlineTimeWindow="15"> <providers> <add name=" AspNetSqlMembershipProvider" type="System.Web.Security.SqlMembershipProvider, System.Web, Version=2.0.3600.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a" connectionStringName="LocalSqlServer" passwordAttemptThreshold="5" passwordAttemptWindow="10" enablePasswordRetrieval="false" enablePasswordReset="true" requiresQuestionAndAnswer="true" applicationName="/" requiresUniqueEmail="false" passwordFormat="Hashed" description="Stores and retrieves membership data from the local Microsoft SQL Server database." /> </providers> </membership> </system.web> ```
The following code example demonstrates how to use the MembershipSection class.
[!code-cs[System.Web.Configuration.MembershipSection#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.configurati_44_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.MembershipSection#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.configurati_44_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The MembershipSection constructor is not intended to be used directly from your code. It is called by the ASP.NET configuration system. You obtain an instance of the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.MembershipSection> class by using the <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration.GetSection%2A> method.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of the default provider that is used to manage roles.
Docs.value: The name of a provider in <xref:System.Web.Configuration.MembershipSection.Providers%2A>. The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The DefaultProvider must match a named value in the `providers` subsection of the `membership` section of the configuration file. An empty string (`""`) is not a valid value for the DefaultProvider property.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the DefaultProvider property. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.MembershipSection> class.
[!code-cs[System.Web.Configuration.MembershipSection#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.configurati_239_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.MembershipSection#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.configurati_239_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the type of encryption that is used for sensitive membership information.
Docs.value: The type of encryption used to encrypt sensitive membership information.

remarks.format:
## Remarks At run time, the membership system binds to the appropriate hash algorithm type, and then uses this type when encrypting membership information. If the HashAlgorithmType property is not set, the membership system defaults to the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.MachineKeySection.Validation%2A> property within the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.MachineKeySection> class.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the HashAlgorithmType property. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.MembershipSection> class.
[!code-cs[System.Web.Configuration.MembershipSection#3](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.configurati_135_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.MembershipSection#3](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.configurati_135_1.vb)]

Docs.value: A that contains the provider's settings, defined within the subsection of the section of the configuration file.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Membership providers are components that provide access to the membership for a site. You can specify membership providers in the `providers` subsection of the `membership` section of the configuration file.
The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.MembershipSection.DefaultProvider%2A> property contains the name of the provider that is used by default.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the Providers property. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.MembershipSection> class.
[!code-cs[System.Web.Configuration.MembershipSection#5](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.configurati_90_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.MembershipSection#5](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.configurati_90_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the length of time, in minutes, before a user is no longer considered to be online.
Docs.value: A length of time in minutes.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The value for the UserIsOnlineTimeWindow property is calculated by comparing the current time minus the UserIsOnlineTimeWindow property with the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipUser.LastActivityDate%2A> value for the user.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the UserIsOnlineTimeWindow property. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.MembershipSection> class.
[!code-cs[System.Web.Configuration.MembershipSection#4](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.configurati_39_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.MembershipSection#4](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.configurati_39_1.vb)]
